developer.name: Andreas Ink
developer.bio: I am passionate about creating apps that enhance productivity and promote healthier lifestyles. As an iOS developer at Rune Labs, a student at the University of North Florida, and a dedicated side project enthusiast, I continuously explore the intersection of technology and personal well-being.
developer.work: iOS developer at Rune Labs, student at University of North FL, and side projects enthusiast.

content.name: Andreas Ink
content.bio: Driven to build apps that empower users to live healthier, more productive lives.

content.content: I balance my role as an iOS developer at Rune Labs with my studies at the University of North Florida, all while pursuing a variety of side projects.

default: In 2020, I joined the Covid Watch initiative, focused on reducing the spread of Covid-19 through Exposure Notifications. This project aimed to encourage safety measures such as isolation or wearing masks after potential exposure.

It was an eye-opening experience where I learned the value of collaboration, and deepened my skills in SwiftUI. I realized that impactful work often comes down to a mix of relentless effort and a bit of luck.
resumeMode: Enhanced user interface using UIKit and SwiftUI.
Helped achieve a 12% reduction in Covid-19 transmission at The University of Arizona.
Propelled the app to 23rd place in the App Store’s medical category.
Developed marketing materials featured on national ABC News.
Supported integration of Google and Apple's Exposure Notification framework.

default: Inspired by Covid Watch, I founded Vito to tackle infectious disease detection with a stronger emphasis on privacy and community engagement. I believed that stricter privacy controls would foster greater user trust and wider adoption.
While Vito was ultimately discontinued, the journey taught me invaluable lessons in research and community building. I remain proud of the collaborative spirit and technical achievements we reached.
resumeMode: Founded Vito for early detection of infectious diseases using biometric data.
Implemented complex algorithms on iOS, Android, and Streamlit using Swift, Kotlin, and Python.
Built and managed a community of 50 student collaborators over a year.

default: Driven by a desire to help my father manage Parkinson’s disease, I co-founded Cerebellia. We built a prototype PCB that interfaced with an iOS app, utilizing Apple’s Movement Disorder toolkit.
The project gained significant media attention, appearing in TechCrunch and The Verge—achieved through a simple cold email. This was a proud moment and showed the power of persistence and outreach.
resumeMode: Featured in TechCrunch and The Verge for breakthroughs in health technology.
Secured special entitlement to use Apple’s Movement Disorder API for measuring tremors with Apple Watch.
Developed a native iOS app that promotes lifestyle adjustments for Parkinson’s patients.

default: After Cerebellia caught attention in tech media, I was offered a role at Rune Labs, which felt like the perfect continuation of my journey in health tech.
Working at Rune has been incredibly fulfilling—collaborating with a fantastic team and having the unique opportunity to test app features directly with my Dad, who has Parkinson's.
resumeMode: Increased App Store ratings for StrivePD by 0.6 stars through enhanced activity and in-app rating features.
Modernized the codebase with Swift Package Manager and SwiftUI integration.
Implemented Siri integration to streamline user interactions with the app.

rune: Designed and implemented a tremor and dyskinesia tracking chart for improved patient insights.
Refreshed the entire app's UI with a modern blend of SwiftUI and UIKit.
Improved Apple Watch stability for continuous monitoring.
Created a tap test feature now utilized by a pharmaceutical partner.
pingPath: Launched PingPath, an app built with SwiftUI to assist visually impaired users.
Conducted user research to refine the UX and ensure accessibility.
Implemented a pathfinding algorithm utilizing spatial audio for guided navigation.
examCram: Released ExamCram, achieving over 5,000 downloads in its first year.
Built the app using SwiftUI, making it compatible with nearly every Apple platform.
Developed a companion React web app to expand access to users beyond the Apple ecosystem.

secondaryText: Thank you for using the app! It’s a result of countless hours of dedication and effort.
I hope it brings value to your life, just as creating it has brought purpose to mine.
If you find this app helpful, please consider leaving a review—it truly makes a difference!

content.label: Explore my resume
content.description: Tap above to learn more about my projects, experiences, and vision.
